text: Kasimkota railway station (station code:KSK),is an Indian railway station near Anakapalle, a neighbourhood of Visakhapatnam in Andhra Pradesh. It lies on the Vijayawada-Chennai section and is administered under Vijayawada railway division of South Central Railway zone. == History == Between 1893 and 1896, of the East Coast State Railway, between Vijayawada and Cuttack was opened for traffic. The southern part of the East Coast State Railway (from Waltair to Vijayawada) was taken over by Madras Railway in 1901. == Classification == Kasimkota railway station is an D–category station of Vijayawada division. == References == == External links == * Category:Railway stations in Visakhapatnam district Category:Vijayawada railway division
title: Kasimkota railway station
